div.head: Rinn and Schenker
div.p: Schenker had extensive correspondence with Rinn between 1927 and 1933 (OJ 5/32, 14 items; 13/25, 45 items). Rinn corresponded under the letterheads of Der Kunstwart (of which he was the editor 1931-37) and the Deutsche Zeitschrift, both of Munich. In correspondence with UE, Schenker arranged for a complete set of Der Tonwille to be sent to Rinn in December 1930 (WSLB 424, OC 52/866).
Schenker published six articles in Der Kunstwart between 1929 and 1933, one of which, Erinnerung an Brahms (Recollection of Brahms), was written for the centenary of Brahms's birth in 1833.
